intro: Beilschmiedia bolavenensis, commonly known as the Bolaven beilschmiedia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in the highlands of Vietnam. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface. It produces small, clustered flowers that are followed by edible, fleshy berries. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
